gameComponents

Class RefractiveZone

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameComponents.GameComponent
      • gameComponents.OpticalObject
        • gameComponents.RefractiveZone
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Lens

    public class RefractiveZone
extends OpticalObject
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Virtual Optics

    This class models a refractive zone. It implements the Cloneable interface to enable objects to be duplicated in a method in the Lab class

    Author:
    Darrin Fong, Tieme Togola
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • refractionIndex

        private double refractionIndex
        This index determines how much a ray is bent when it enters the refractive zone; values between 1.0 and 5.0

      • outerIndex

        private double outerIndex
        The refraction index of the zone surrounding this refractive zone. Value of 1.0 if it is not nested in another zone

      • width

        private int width
        Width of the rectangular shape of this refractive zone

      • height

        private int height
        Height of the rectangular shape of this refractive zone

      • checkOrientation

        public boolean checkOrientation(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double p,
                       java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double useless,
                       LineEq segment)
        Always returns true here because a ray of light will always pass through this kind of optical object
        Specified by:
        checkOrientation in class OpticalObject
        Parameters:
        p - The source point of the ray segment that hit this optical object
        useless - The intersection point of the ray segment and this optical object
        segment - The ray segment that hit this optical object
        Returns:
        True if the ray can interact with this side of the optical object, false otherwise
        See Also:
        OpticalObject.checkOrientation(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double, java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double, gameComponents.LineEq)

      • checkSide

        public boolean checkSide(LineEq incidentLine,
                LineEq resultLine,
                java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double source,
                java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double intersec)
        Description copied from class: OpticalObject
        Checks if the reflected/refracted ray is on the correct side of the normal line. (Varies from one optical object to another)
        Specified by:
        checkSide in class OpticalObject
        source - The source point of the ray segment that hit this optical object
        intersec - The intersection point of the ray segment and this optical object
        Returns:
        False if the reflected/refracted ray is on the correct side, true otherwise
        See Also:

      • refraction

        public double refraction(double n1,
                double n2,
                double m1,
                double m2)
        Computes the slope of a ray segment refracted by this optical object
        Parameters:
        n1 - The refraction index of the origin zone of the ray
        n2 - The refraction index of the current zone
        m1 - Slope of the incident ray
        m2 - Slope of the normal line of this optical object
        Returns:
        Slope of the refracted ray

      • criticalAngle

        public double criticalAngle(double n1,
                   double n2)
        The critical angle is the angle at which a ray is reflected instead of refracted in a refractive zone. This occurs if its incidence angle is greater than the critical angle
        Parameters:
        n1 - Refractive index of origin zone
        n2 - Refractive index of destination zone
        Returns:
        Critical angle of this zone

      • exiting

        public boolean exiting(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double source,
              java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double intersec)
        Tells if the ray interacting with this refractive zone is coming in or out of the zone
        Parameters:
        source - Source end point of the ray segment
        intersec - Intersection point of the ray with this zone
        Returns:
        True of going out, false if coming in
